comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The photographer gave Mrs Macquarie a promotion!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Hmmmm . . . . The 1875 John Sands Sydney map calls it "Lady Macquaries Chair" www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-f110-sd&rgn=0.3... . And by 1890 she had become "Mrs Macquarie's Chair" - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-rm1280-s1-sd&rg...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Here is some fun - judging from the size of the trees, this is the earliest of three views by different photographers. Open them in seperate tabs and compare: King - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2532451641/sizes/o/ Phillips - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/3310072249/sizes/o/ Kerry - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2468849891/sizes/o/

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: A few more early views: c.1870-1875 - American & Australasian Photo Co. acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=63574 1900 - Wilson Mew acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=421119 c.1900-1910 - Star Photo Co. acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=413785
